cyclone.name: CLAUDETTE
cyclone.current_location: about 125 mi south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving north to north-northeast toward the south-central Louisiana coast, then expected to curve northeast across the southeastern United States
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Morgan City, Louisiana (north-central Gulf Coast)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None – watch has been upgraded to a warning for this area
weather_observation.warning_coast: East of Morgan City, LA to the Okaloosa/Walton County line, FL, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas and Metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: north-central Gulf Coast from Louisiana through Mississippi, Alabama and the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph with higher gusts) likely beginning overnight Friday and lasting into Saturday morning.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 2–3 ft above ground level possible along the lower Mississippi River and adjacent bays, including areas near the port complex.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 in of rain with isolated totals to 12 in could trigger flash flooding and minor river rises around the port area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: A few tornadoes are possible in rainbands, primarily Saturday.
